text: Rhodes Hambridge (1913-1993) was an Australian born male rower who competed for England. ==Rowing career== Hambridge represented England and won a gold medal in the eights at the 1938 British Empire Games in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. ==Personal life== He was an physician by trade. He lived in Teesdale Avenue, Isleworth and was a medical student at the time of the 1938 Games. ==References== Category:1913 births Category:1993 deaths Category:English male rowers Category:Rowers at the 1938 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in rowing Category:Commonwealth Games gold medallists for England
title: Rhodes Hambridge
